messages.subject: online teen "hangout"--Habbo

messages.messageBody:
© 2007 - 2008 Sulake Corporation Oy. HABBO is a registered trademark
of Sulake Corporation Oy in the European Union, the USA, Japan, the
People's Republic of China and various other jurisdictions. All
rights reserved.

That's the note from the bottom of Habbo.com

http://www.habbo.com

I thought some of you might have kids who are restless and could use
a new hobby. I saw this advertised on Neopets. It says "Habbo--
hangout for teens" and it seems one registers for free, creates an
icon that looks like a Lego person, and it looks like they can have
text conversations with other players.

Other than that, I don't know. Holly, my youngest, is already using
MySpace as her virtual world (and many of her real-life friends keep
in touch with her there), but this looks simpler and cute. I haven't
been in there and so can't vouch for it, but the week before
Christmas can sometimes use more things for kids to do.

Sandra
